column2: and she realized she hadn't been hallucinating
column3: but dreaming. The clock on the desk read 12:55. They'd begun their ten-minute session at 12:25
column4: so obviously she had twenty minutes to account for.

column1: 0055|five minutes to one|At five minutes to one
column2: the host of the show emerged from a heated tent to massive applause from the crowd. She was dressed in a fuchsia coat

column3: listened to the loud tick of the clock
column4: and was asleep a minute later. Five to one in the morning. Fifty-one hours to go.
